Package fr.sorbonne_u.alasca.examples.memory_allocation

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    HighMemoryAllocationDecision
    The class HighMemoryAllocationDecision allocates more memory when the memory consumption is high and this amount of memory is available.
    HighMemoryConsumption
    The class HighMemoryConsumption asserts that a high memory consumption is observed when it is greater than a predefined threshold.
    LowMemoryAllocationDecision
    The class LowMemoryAllocationDecision allocates some memory when the memory consumption is medium and some memory is available.
    LowMemoryConsumption
    The class LowMemoryConsumption asserts that neither a high nor a medium memory consumption is observed when it is lower than a predefined threshold.
    MediumMemoryConsumption
    The class MediumMemoryConsumption asserts that a medium memory consumption is observed when it is between predefined lower and upper thresholds.
    MemoryAllocation
    The class MemoryAllocation illustrates the use of the Easy Rules library on an example where decisions are made about allocating more memory to a process when its memory consumption reaches thresholds in terms of percentage of the currently allocated memory that is actually used by the process.
    NoMemoryAllocationDecision
    The class NoMemoryAllocationDecision allocates no memory when the memory consumption is not large enough to justify it.
